body:
I don't understand this PR.

For archive-only docs, I'm OK with big giant PRs moving them from point-A to point-B.

But if we're going to add content and expect real reviews, we should do things one-at-a-time.  Seems like some of these docs aren't converted as much as simply run through `pandoc` and committed.

Even low-priority docs should render well and be included in the `mkdocs.yml`.  If they're low-priority enough to not put them in the table of contents, then they don't need to be converted to markdown -- they can just live in the archive.

(Hm -- we should probably have a Travis-CI check to verify that all `*.md` docs are listed in `mkdocs.yml`.)
